text: Wash the lemon. Pare it thinly into long, thin strips. Mix the wine, sugar, cinnamon stick and cloves in a heavy-based saucepan.  Bring to the boil. Reduce heat, add the lemon peel and allow to simmer for 5 minutes. Remove from heat.  Add the apricots. You can serve as they are (warm) or choose to marinate. If you marinate the apricots, leave for about half an hour to an hour; place in refrigerator when cooled. The marinated version is better for a dinner party, served chilled with cream. The warm version is suitable for a hearty home dessert on a cold night, served with pudding. Finished.
